citation.article-title: Gordonia lacunae sp. nov., isolated from an estuary.

p.s: Description of Gordonia lacunae sp. nov.
Gordonia lacunae (la.cu’na.e L. gen. fem. n. lacunae meaning of or from a lagoon, isolated from sand taken from a lagoon).
Strain BS2T is a Gram-positive, partially acid-fast (but not acid-alcohol fast) actinomycete that forms pink-orange (yellow-orange when not exposed to light) growth on ISP 2 agar.
Light yellow-brown growth is observed on inorganic salts starch agar (ISP 4); no diffusible pigment is produced on glycerol–asparagine agar (ISP 5) and growth is sparse and colourless.
No melanin production is observed on peptone–yeast extract–iron agar (ISP 6) and tyrosine agar (ISP 7).
The mycelium fragments into non-motile, rod-shaped elements on agar.
Good growth is observed on ISP 2 agar.
Weak antibiosis is exhibited against Mycobacterium aurum A+ in agar overlays.

Bioautographic analysis of organic solvent extracts of the cell mass shows weak antibiosis against M. aurum A+ and Mycobacterium smegmatis LR222, but no activity against Mycobacterium tuberculosis H37RvT (=ATCC 27294T).
Strain BS2T is catalase positive and oxidase negative.
It grows in the presence of 0.3% 2-phenylethanol, 7% NaCl, 0.02% NaN3 and 0.1% phenol.

Growth was observed in the presence of cephaloridine (100 μg/ml), kanamycin (100 μg/ml), oleandomycin (100 μg/ml), penicillin G (10 i.u./ml), rifampicin (50 μg/ml), tobramycin (50 μg/ml) and vancomycin (50 μg/ml), but not in the presence of gentamicin (100 μg/ml), lincomycin (100 μg/ml), neomycin (50 μg/ml) and streptomycin (100 μg/ml).
Growth was observed at 30 °C, 37 °C and pH 4.3, with weak growth observed at 4 °C.

BS2T utilizes l-arginine, l-cysteine, l-histidine, l-methionine, potassium nitrate, l-serine and l-valine as sole nitrogen sources (with weak utilization of dl-α-amino-n-butyric acid, l-hydroxyproline and l-phenylalanine). l(+) Arabinose, d(+) cellobiose, d(−) fructose, d(+) glucose, d(−) lactose, d(−) mannitol, d(+) mannose, l(+) rhamnose, sodium citrate (0.1%), sucrose, trehalose, xylitol and d(+) xylose are utilized as sole carbon sources.

Adonitol, d(+) galactose, meso-inositol, d(+) melezitose, d(+) melibiose, raffinose, salicin and sodium acetate (0.1%) are weakly utilized, but inulin and d(−) ribose are not utilized as sole carbon sources.
Nitrate is reduced and H2S production occurs.
Only lecithinase activity is observed on egg-yolk agar.
Neither hippurate nor pectin are hydrolysed.
Strain BS2T degrades aesculin, casein and Tween 80.
Arbutin, guanine and urea are weakly degraded, while adenine, allantoin, gelatine, hypoxanthine, starch, l-tyrosine, xanthine and xylan are not degraded.
The type strain is BS2T (=DSM 45085T =NRRL B-24551T).
